chargeHist.descr: Purchase Pseudoephedrine for Another with Intent/Facilitate Another Person's Manufacture of Meth

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus M. Fernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Purchase Pseudoephedrine for Another with Intent/Facilitate Another Person's Manufacture of Meth, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.453(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

01:48 pm - Defendant Jesus M. Fernandez in court with attorney Anne M. Katte.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Schiek/Katte/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence

Appeal rights and NADVI given

2:14 p.m. Defendant Jesus M. Fernandez in court with attorney Anne M. Katte. Michael William Schiek, D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Katte in agreement with going forward as Information will mirror complaint. Defendant pleads not guilty. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

03:00 pm - GBA for PFO - Defendant Jesus M. Fernandez in court with attorney Anne M. Katte.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
no contact with anyone listed in the complaint, Michael J. Steinmetz, Jr., Jamie S. Rickert, Carrie A. Steinmetz, Crystal S. Schirmacher and/or William E. Campbell and/or Jessica Steinmetz

01:24 pm - Defendant Jesus M. Fernandez in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant contacted PD and was found eligible, no one available for today's hearing,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
